pullRequest.title: Vertx - fix default value for VertxConfiguration#maxWorkerExecuteTime
pullRequest.bodyText:
see also
https://vertx.io/docs/apidocs/io/vertx/core/VertxOptions.html#DEFAULT_MAX_WORKER_EXECUTE_TIME
also add some info how to pass the duration value

beforeCommit.message:
Vertx - fix default value for VertxConfiguration#maxWorkerExecuteTime

- see also
https://vertx.io/docs/apidocs/io/vertx/core/VertxOptions.html#DEFAULT_MAX_WORKER_EXECUTE_TIME
- also add some info how to pass the duration value

afterCommit.message:
Vertx - fix default value for VertxConfiguration#maxWorkerExecuteTime

- see also
https://vertx.io/docs/apidocs/io/vertx/core/VertxOptions.html#DEFAULT_MAX_WORKER_EXECUTE_TIME
- also add some info how to pass the duration value

nodes.bodyText: There's a note added automatically to the generated documentation with this information, no need to add it here.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -32,12 +32,20 @@ /** * The maximum amount of time the event loop can be blocked. * Default is 2s. + *

+ * The value is parsed via the {@link Duration#parse()} method. + * If the value consists only of digits the converter treats the value as seconds. + * If the value starts with digits the {@code PT} prefix is implicitly prepended to the value.

nodes.bodyText: And maybe I would push these default values to defaultValue instead.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -32,12 +32,20 @@ /** * The maximum amount of time the event loop can be blocked. * Default is 2s. + *

+ * The value is parsed via the {@link Duration#parse()} method. + * If the value consists only of digits the converter treats the value as seconds. + * If the value starts with digits the {@code PT} prefix is implicitly prepended to the value.

afterCommit.message:
Vertx - fix default value for VertxConfiguration#maxWorkerExecuteTime

- see also
https://vertx.io/docs/apidocs/io/vertx/core/VertxOptions.html#DEFAULT_MAX_WORKER_EXECUTE_TIME

nodes.bodyText: The nice thing is that you can drop the default from the javadoc now. That's why I asked :).
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -33,8 +32,8 @@
      * The maximum amount of time the event loop can be blocked.
      * Default is 2s.
      */
-    @ConfigItem
-    public Optional<Duration> maxEventLoopExecuteTime;
+    @ConfigItem(defaultValue = "2")
